responses: Yo! What's good? Ask me about any Gen Z slang or memes!
Hey! Ready to decode some slang? Hit me with your questions!
What's up! I'm here to explain all the Gen Z lingo. What do you wanna know?

patterns: What is the meaning of rizz?
Why do people say someone has rizz?
What does it mean to rizz someone up?
Is rizz the same as charisma?
How do you use rizz in a sentence?
responses: Rizz means charisma or smooth flirting ability. Someone with rizz can charm or attract others easily. Example: 'Bro got her number in 2 minutes, he's got W rizz!'
Rizz = your game/charm when talking to people you're interested in. Coined by streamer Kai Cenat. If you can pull anyone, you got that rizz fr fr.
Rizz is basically modern slang for charisma, especially romantic charisma. 'He rizzes up everyone at parties' means he's smooth with flirting.
It's your flirting skills and charm! W rizz = good game, L rizz = no game. Unspoken rizz = attracting people without even trying.

patterns: What does no cap vs cap mean?
Why do people say that's cap?
Is cap the same as lying?
responses: Cap means a lie or something false. Saying 'that's cap' means 'that's not true.' Example: 'He said he bench presses 300lbsâ€”that's cap!'
Cap = lying or exaggerating. Comes from the phrase 'capping' which means lying. Stop capping = stop lying to me bro.
Yeah cap means lying! If someone says 'you capping,' they're calling you out for lying. The opposite is 'no cap' which means you're being real.

patterns: Why do people say no cap?
Is no cap like saying I'm serious?
Use no cap in a sentence.
responses: No cap means 'I'm serious' or 'no lie.' It emphasizes honesty and truthfulness. Example: 'This is the best pizza I've ever had, no cap.'
No cap = I'm being 100% honest, not lying at all. You use it to emphasize you're telling the truth. 'That movie was mid, no cap.'
It literally means 'no lie' or 'for real.' Add it to the end of statements to show you're being genuine. No cap is the opposite of cap (lying).

patterns: Why do people say things are mid?
What does calling something mid imply?
Give me the meaning of mid.
responses: Mid means average, mediocre, or unimpressiveâ€”not good, not terrible. Example: 'That restaurant was mid, nothing special.'
Mid = mediocre or disappointing. If something is mid, it's meh, just okay. 'The movie was mid' = it wasn't worth the hype.
Calling something mid means it's underwhelming or just average. Often used when something doesn't live up to expectations. It's not necessarily bad, just not impressive.

patterns: What does iykyk mean in texting?
responses: IYKYK stands for 'if you know, you know'â€”meaning something only certain people will understand. It's for inside jokes or shared experiences.
IYKYK = If You Know, You Know. Used when referencing something that only a specific group would understand. Example: 'That restaurant at 2am hits different iykyk ðŸ‘€'
It means there's context or an inside joke that only some people get. If you weren't there or don't have the experience, you won't understand it.

patterns: He's goated at thisâ€”what does that mean?
Is goated the same as GOAT?
responses: Goated means exceptionally good or the best at somethingâ€”derived from GOAT (Greatest Of All Time). Example: 'LeBron is goated fr.'
Goated = being at GOAT level (Greatest Of All Time). If someone is goated at basketball, they're elite, top tier, the best.
Yeah it comes from GOAT! When you call someone goated, you're saying they're legendary or the absolute best at what they do.

patterns: Why do people say something is cheugy?
Give me the definition of cheugy.
responses: Cheugy describes something outdated, trying too hard, or no longer fashionable. Think millennial trends that Gen Z finds cringe. Example: 'Live laugh love signs are so cheugy.'
Cheugy = out of style or trying too hard to be trendy but missing the mark. Coined in 2013 but went viral on TikTok in 2021. Basically means uncool or dated.
It's used for things that are basic, outdated, or trying too hard. Like skinny jeans, Starbucks obsession, or 'girlboss' energyâ€”all cheugy according to Gen Z.

patterns: Why do people call things sus?
responses: Sus means suspicious or sketchyâ€”something feels off or untrustworthy. Popularized by Among Us. Example: 'Why is he acting so sus right now?'
Sus = suspicious or questionable. Blown up thanks to the game Among Us. If something seems sus, it's giving off weird vibes or doesn't add up.
Yeah it's short for suspicious! Use it when something or someone seems sketchy, weird, or not quite right. 'That's sus' = that's suspicious/questionable.
Bet is used to say 'okay,' 'sounds good,' or 'I agree.' It can also mean accepting a challenge. Example: 'Wanna grab food?' 'Bet!'
Bet = agreement or confirmation. Like saying 'for sure' or 'alright cool.' You can also use it to accept a dare: 'You won't jump in the pool' 'Bet.'
It's basically 'okay' or 'deal.' Short and casual way to agree with someone or confirm plans. 'See you at 6?' 'Bet.'

patterns: Why do people say someone slayed?
Define slay in Gen Z terms.
responses: Slay means to do something exceptionally well, especially in style or confidence. Example: 'She walked into the party and absolutely slayed!'
Slay = killing it, doing amazing, looking incredible. If someone slays, they're nailing whatever they're doing with confidence and style. Very positive!
It means you absolutely crushed itâ€”performed, looked, or executed something perfectly. 'Slay queen!' is a compliment meaning you're doing amazing.

patterns: Why do people tell others to touch grass?
responses: Touch grass means to go outside or take a break from the internetâ€”usually said jokingly. Example: 'Bro has been gaming for 12 hours, he needs to touch grass.'
'Touch grass' is telling someone they need to go outside and experience real life instead of being chronically online. Can be playful or calling someone out.
It's a meme phrase meaning 'get off the internet and go outside.' Said when someone's being too online, too obsessed, or needs some fresh air and reality.

patterns: What does ate mean in slang?
What does it mean when someone 'ate'?
Why do people say 'ate and left no crumbs'?
responses: Ate means someone performed extremely wellâ€”often in fashion, dancing, or performance. Example: 'She ate that choreography!'
'Ate' or 'ate and left no crumbs' means someone absolutely killed it and left nothing for anyone else. They were THAT good. Usually about performances or looks.
When someone 'ate,' they devoured the assignment, did it perfectly. No notes, no complaintsâ€”they just completely dominated whatever they were doing.

patterns: Why do people say someone is washed?
responses: Washed means someone is past their prime or out of touch with current trends. Example: 'He still uses Facebook unironically, he's washed.'
Washed = you're no longer good at something you used to be good at, or you're outdated. Often used in gaming or sports. 'That player is washed, he used to be great.'
Calling someone washed means they've lost their edge or are no longer relevant. Can refer to skills declining or being out of touch with what's current.

patterns: Why do people call others delulu?
responses: Delulu is slang for being delusional in a playful or exaggerated way, often about crushes or fantasies. Example: 'I'm delulu thinking my crush will text me first.'
Delulu = delusional, but used lightheartedly. Usually about unrealistic hopes in dating or fantasizing about unlikely scenarios. 'Delulu is the solulu' (delusion is the solution) is a meme phrase!
It's being delusional but embracing it! Often used when manifesting or having unrealistic expectations. 'I'm being delulu but I think we're soulmates after one conversation.'

patterns: Why do people say someone looks snatched?
responses: Snatched means looking extremely goodâ€”polished, styled, or put together perfectly. Example: 'Her makeup is snatched today!'
Snatched = on point, flawless, looking incredible. Often used for fashion, makeup, or body. 'Your outfit is snatched!' = you look amazing.
When someone looks snatched, they're serving looksâ€”everything is perfectly styled and they look fire. Very positive compliment!

patterns: Why do people say someone is based?
responses: Based means being unapologetically yourself or expressing an opinion confidently, regardless of judgment. Example: 'He said pineapple on pizza is goodâ€”based.'
Based = not caring what others think and speaking your truth. Originated from rapper Lil B. If someone's based, they're authentic and don't follow the crowd.
Being based means expressing your genuine opinion even if it's unpopular or controversial. It's about being real and not performative. Generally positive!

patterns: What does fire mean in slang?
Why do people call things fire?
responses: Fire means something is excellent, exciting, or impressive. Example: 'This song is fire! ðŸ”¥'
Fire = amazing, hot, incredible. Used to describe anything you think is really good. 'That concert was fire' = it was awesome.
Yeah fire is super positive! It means something is heat, top tier, really good. Often accompanied by the ðŸ”¥ emoji.
Lowkey means subtly, secretly, or mildlyâ€”without making it a big deal. Example: 'I lowkey want to skip class today.'
Lowkey = kinda, sort of, or on the down-low. You're not being loud about it but it's true. 'I'm lowkey tired' = I'm somewhat tired but not making a fuss.
It's like saying 'secretly' or 'somewhat.' You're downplaying it. 'Lowkey obsessed with this show' = I like it but I'm not being dramatic about it.

patterns: Is highkey just the opposite of lowkey?
responses: Highkey means openly, obviously, or stronglyâ€”making it known without holding back. Example: 'I'm highkey stressed about this exam.'
Highkey = very, extremely, openly. The opposite of lowkey. You're not hiding it at all. 'Highkey love this song' = I'm loudly and proudly obsessed with it.
Yeah it's the opposite of lowkey! Highkey means you're being obvious or vocal about something. Not downplaying it at allâ€”you're all in.

patterns: Why do people call someone a simp?
responses: A simp is someone who shows excessive attention or affection toward someone they like, often in a way that seems one-sided. Example: 'He bought her a $200 gift and they just metâ€”he's simping.'
Simp = someone who does way too much for someone they're attracted to, usually getting nothing in return. Can be used jokingly or as an insult.
Simping means giving someone too much attention, praise, or gifts hoping they'll like you back. Often used when someone's being overly nice or desperate for attention.
Yeet is an exclamation for excitement or used when forcefully throwing something. Example: 'I'm gonna yeet this paper ball across the room!'
Yeet = to throw something with force and enthusiasm. Also used as an excited exclamation. Kinda old slang now but still used. 'YEET!' *throws something*
It means to throw forcefully or it's an expression of excitement. 'Yeet that ball!' = throw it hard. Or just yell 'YEET!' when you're hyped.
Bruh is a casual expression of disbelief, frustration, or surprise. Example: 'Bruh, did you really just say that?'
Bruh = bro but with more exasperation or disbelief. You say it when something is ridiculous, frustrating, or surprising. 'Bruh moment' = facepalm situation.
It's like 'bro' but more of a reaction. Used when you're shocked, annoyed, or can't believe something. 'Bruh...' says it all sometimes.
Fax means 'facts'â€”used to strongly agree with something true. Example: 'Pizza is better than tacos.' 'Fax!'
Fax = facts, you're speaking truth. It's enthusiastic agreement. Someone says something real and you respond 'fax' or 'straight fax' to show you 100% agree.
It's just 'facts' spelled like the machine! Means you're completely right, that's the truth. 'That test was impossible' 'Fax, no printer!'

patterns: Why do people say you got ratioed?
What happens when someone is ratioed?
responses: Ratio means receiving more negative replies than likesâ€”implying your take was unpopular. On Twitter, if a reply gets more likes than your original tweet, you got ratioed.
Getting ratioed = your post/comment got dunked on. When people disagree so much that the replies get more engagement than your original post. It's an L.
To ratio someone means to reply to their post and get more likes than them, showing their opinion was bad/unpopular. 'Ratio + L + you fell off' is a classic clap back.

patterns: Why do people say someone is pressed?
responses: Pressed means upset, bothered, or annoyed by somethingâ€”more than necessary. Example: 'Why are you so pressed about it? It's not that deep.'
Being pressed = taking something too seriously or being overly bothered. Someone who's pressed is worked up over something small. 'He's so pressed right now.'
Pressed means you're stressed, upset, or taking things too personally. Usually implies you're overreacting or being too sensitive about something.

patterns: What does doing too much mean?
Why do people say someone is doing too much?
responses: Doing too much means behaving overly dramatic, extra, or trying too hard. Example: 'She's doing too much trying to get attention.'
Doing too much = being extra, over the top, or trying way too hard. Could be about attention-seeking, overdressing for a casual event, or just being dramatic.
It means you're being excessive or going overboard. Similar to being 'extra.' Someone who does too much is trying too hard or being unnecessarily dramatic.

patterns: Why do people say I stan?
responses: To stan means to strongly support, idolize, or obsessively admire someone. Example: 'I stan Taylor Swift!' From Eminem's song 'Stan' about an obsessed fan.
Stan = being a super fan of someone or something. You can stan a celebrity, a show, a character. 'We stan a queen!' = we love and support her!
Stanning is being a hardcore fan. Comes from Eminem's 2000 song 'Stan' about an obsessive fan. Now it means you love and support someone/something intensely.

patterns: Why do people say they have FOMO?
responses: FOMO stands for Fear Of Missing Outâ€”the feeling that others are experiencing something you're not. Example: 'Everyone's at the party except me, major FOMO right now.'
FOMO = Fear Of Missing Out. That anxiety you get when you see others having fun without you. Social media makes FOMO worseâ€”you see everything you're missing!
Yeah it's the anxiety that you're missing out on something fun or important that everyone else is doing. FOMO hits hard when you see those group pics without you.

patterns: Why do people say someone had a glow up?
responses: Glow up means a major improvement in appearance, confidence, or lifestyle over time. Example: 'His glow up from middle school to now is insane!'
A glow up is a transformation where someone becomes more attractive, confident, or successful. Usually physical but can be overall life improvement. Definitely a compliment!
Glow up = positive transformation. Could be better style, fitness, confidence, careerâ€”any major improvement. 'She had such a glow up!' = she leveled up significantly.

patterns: What does tea mean in slang?
Why do people say spill the tea?
What does it mean to spill tea?
responses: Tea means gossip or informationâ€”'spilling the tea' means sharing the details. Example: 'Girl, I got some tea about what happened at the party!'
Tea = gossip, drama, or juicy information. 'Spill the tea' means tell me everything! 'Sip tea' means enjoying drama while staying out of it. â˜•
Spilling tea is sharing gossip or insider information. It's the drama, the story, the details everyone wants to know. 'What's the tea?' = what's going on?

patterns: Tell me about a random meme.
Tell me about a famous meme.
responses: Let me tell you about a random meme!
